5#ifdef _WIN32
6#include <ciso646>
7#endif
8
9#include <functional>
10#include <memory>
11#include <utility>
12#include <type_traits>
13#include <chrono>
14#include <uv.h>
15#include "emitter.h"
16#include "util.h"

18
19namespace uvw {
20
21
22class AsyncHandle;
23class CheckHandle;
24class FsEventHandle;
25class FsPollHandle;
26class IdleHandle;
27class PipeHandle;
28class PollHandle;
29class PrepareHandle;
30class ProcessHandle;
31class SignalHandle;
32class TCPHandle;
33class TimerHandle;
34class TTYHandle;
35class UDPHandle;
36
37
38namespace details {
39
40
41enum class UVLoopOption: std::underlying_type_t<uv_loop_option> {
42 BLOCK_SIGNAL = UV_LOOP_BLOCK_SIGNAL
43};
44
45
46enum class UVRunMode: std::underlying_type_t<uv_run_mode> {
47 DEFAULT = UV_RUN_DEFAULT,
48 ONCE = UV_RUN_ONCE,
49 NOWAIT = UV_RUN_NOWAIT
50};
51
52
53}
54
55
56/**
57 * @brief The Loop class.
58 *
59 * The event loop is the central part of `uvw`'s functionalities, as well as
60 * `libuv`'s ones.<br/>
61 * It takes care of polling for I/O and scheduling callbacks to be run based on
62 * different sources of events.
63 */
64class Loop final: public Emitter<Loop>, public std::enable_shared_from_this<Loop> {
65 using Deleter = void(*)(uv_loop_t *);
66
67 template<typename, typename>
68 friend class Resource;
69
70 template<typename R, typename... Args>
71 auto create_resource(int, Args&&... args) -> decltype(std::declval<R>().init(), std::shared_ptr<R>{}) {
72 auto ptr = R::create(shared_from_this(), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
73 ptr = ptr->init() ? ptr : nullptr;
74 return ptr;
75 }
76
77 template<typename R, typename... Args>
78 std::shared_ptr<R> create_resource(char, Args&&... args) {
79 return R::create(shared_from_this(), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
80 }
81
82 Loop(std::unique_ptr<uv_loop_t, Deleter> ptr) noexcept;
83
84public:
85 using Time = std::chrono::duration<uint64_t, std::milli>;
86 using Configure = details::UVLoopOption;
87 using Mode = details::UVRunMode;
88
89 /**
90 * @brief Initializes a new Loop instance.
91 * @return A pointer to the newly created loop.
92 */
93 static std::shared_ptr<Loop> create();
94
95 /**
96 * @brief Initializes a new Loop instance from an existing resource.
97 *
98 * The lifetime of the resource must exceed that of the instance to which
99 * it's associated. Management of the memory associated with the resource is
100 * in charge of the user.
101 *
102 * @param loop A valid pointer to a correctly initialized resource.
103 * @return A pointer to the newly created loop.
104 */
105 static std::shared_ptr<Loop> create(uv_loop_t *loop);
106
107 /**
108 * @brief Gets the initialized default loop.
109 *
110 * It may return an empty pointer in case of failure.<br>
111 * This function is just a convenient way for having a global loop
112 * throughout an application, the default loop is in no way different than
113 * the ones initialized with `create()`.<br>
114 * As such, the default loop can be closed with `close()` so the resources
115 * associated with it are freed (even if it is not strictly necessary).
116 *
117 * @return The initialized default loop.
118 */
119 static std::shared_ptr<Loop> getDefault();
120
121 Loop(const Loop &) = delete;
122 Loop(Loop &&other) = delete;
123 Loop & operator=(const Loop &) = delete;
124 Loop & operator=(Loop &&other) = delete;
125
126 ~Loop() noexcept;
127
128 /**
129 * @brief Sets additional loop options.
130 *
131 * You should normally call this before the first call to uv_run() unless
132 * mentioned otherwise.<br/>
133 * Supported options:
134 *
135 * * `Loop::Configure::BLOCK_SIGNAL`: Block a signal when polling for new
136 * events. A second argument is required and it is the signal number.
137 *
138 * An ErrorEvent will be emitted in case of errors.
139 *
140 * See the official
141 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/loop.html#c.uv_loop_configure)
142 * for further details.
143 */
144 template<typename... Args>
145 void configure(Configure flag, Args&&... args) {
146 auto option = static_cast<std::underlying_type_t<Configure>>(flag);
147 auto err = uv_loop_configure(loop.get(), static_cast<uv_loop_option>(option), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
148 if(err) { publish(ErrorEvent{err}); }
149 }
150
151 /**
152 * @brief Creates resources of any type.
153 *
154 * This should be used as a default method to create resources.<br/>
155 * The arguments are the ones required for the specific resource.
156 *
157 * Use it as `loop->resource<uvw::TimerHandle>()`.
158 *
159 * @return A pointer to the newly created resource.
160 */
161 template<typename R, typename... Args>
162 std::shared_ptr<R> resource(Args&&... args) {
163 return create_resource<R>(0, std::forward<Args>(args)...);
164 }
165
166 /**
167 * @brief Releases all internal loop resources.
168 *
169 * Call this function only when the loop has finished executing and all open
170 * handles and requests have been closed, or the loop will emit an error.
171 *
172 * An ErrorEvent will be emitted in case of errors.
173 */
174 void close();
175
176 /**
177 * @brief Runs the event loop.
178 *
179 * Available modes are:
180 *
181 * * `Loop::Mode::DEFAULT`: Runs the event loop until there are no more
182 * active and referenced handles or requests.
183 * * `Loop::Mode::ONCE`: Poll for i/o once. Note that this function blocks
184 * if there are no pending callbacks.
185 * * `Loop::Mode::NOWAIT`: Poll for i/o once but don’t block if there are no
186 * pending callbacks.
187 *
188 * See the official
189 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/loop.html#c.uv_run)
190 * for further details.
191 *
192 * @return True when done, false in all other cases.
193 */
194 template<Mode mode = Mode::DEFAULT>
195 bool run() noexcept;
196
197 /**
198 * @brief Checks if there are active resources.
199 * @return True if there are active resources in the loop.
200 */
201 bool alive() const noexcept;
202
203 /**
204 * @brief Stops the event loop.
205 *
206 * It causes `run()` to end as soon as possible.<br/>
207 * This will happen not sooner than the next loop iteration.<br/>
208 * If this function was called before blocking for I/O, the loop won’t block
209 * for I/O on this iteration.
210 */
211 void stop() noexcept;
212
213 /**
214 * @brief Get backend file descriptor.
215 *
216 * Only kqueue, epoll and event ports are supported.<br/>
217 * This can be used in conjunction with `run<Loop::Mode::NOWAIT>()` to poll
218 * in one thread and run the event loop’s callbacks in another.
219 *
220 * @return The backend file descriptor.
221 */
222 int descriptor() const noexcept;
223
224 /**
225 * @brief Gets the poll timeout.
226 * @return A `std::pair` composed as it follows:
227 * * A boolean value that is true in case of valid timeout, false otherwise.
228 * * Milliseconds (`std::chrono::duration<uint64_t, std::milli>`).
229 */
230 std::pair<bool, Time> timeout() const noexcept;
231
232 /**
233 * @brief Returns the current timestamp in milliseconds.
234 *
235 * The timestamp is cached at the start of the event loop tick.<br/>
236 * The timestamp increases monotonically from some arbitrary point in
237 * time.<br/>
238 * Don’t make assumptions about the starting point, you will only get
239 * disappointed.
240 *
241 * @return The current timestamp in milliseconds (actual type is
242 * `std::chrono::duration<uint64_t, std::milli>`).
243 */
244 Time now() const noexcept;
245
246 /**
247 * @brief Updates the event loop’s concept of _now_.
248 *
249 * The current time is cached at the start of the event loop tick in order
250 * to reduce the number of time-related system calls.<br/>
251 * You won’t normally need to call this function unless you have callbacks
252 * that block the event loop for longer periods of time, where _longer_ is
253 * somewhat subjective but probably on the order of a millisecond or more.
254 */
255 void update() const noexcept;
256
257 /**
258 * @brief Walks the list of handles.
259 *
260 * The callback will be executed once for each handle that is still active.
261 *
262 * @param callback A function to be invoked once for each active handle.
263 */
264 template<typename Func>
265 void walk(Func callback) {
266 // remember: non-capturing lambdas decay to pointers to functions
267 uv_walk(loop.get(), [](uv_handle_t *handle, void *func) {
268 auto &cb = *static_cast<Func *>(func);
269
270 switch(Utilities::guessHandle(HandleCategory{handle->type})) {
271 case HandleType::ASYNC:
272 cb(*static_cast<AsyncHandle *>(handle->data));
273 break;
274 case HandleType::CHECK:
275 cb(*static_cast<CheckHandle *>(handle->data));
276 break;
277 case HandleType::FS_EVENT:
278 cb(*static_cast<FsEventHandle *>(handle->data));
279 break;
280 case HandleType::FS_POLL:
281 cb(*static_cast<FsPollHandle *>(handle->data));
282 break;
283 case HandleType::IDLE:
284 cb(*static_cast<IdleHandle *>(handle->data));
285 break;
286 case HandleType::PIPE:
287 cb(*static_cast<PipeHandle *>(handle->data));
288 break;
289 case HandleType::POLL:
290 cb(*static_cast<PollHandle *>(handle->data));
291 break;
292 case HandleType::PREPARE:
293 cb(*static_cast<PrepareHandle *>(handle->data));
294 break;
295 case HandleType::PROCESS:
296 cb(*static_cast<ProcessHandle *>(handle->data));
297 break;
298 case HandleType::SIGNAL:
299 cb(*static_cast<SignalHandle *>(handle->data));
300 break;
301 case HandleType::TCP:
302 cb(*static_cast<TCPHandle *>(handle->data));
303 break;
304 case HandleType::TIMER:
305 cb(*static_cast<TimerHandle *>(handle->data));
306 break;
307 case HandleType::TTY:
308 cb(*static_cast<TTYHandle *>(handle->data));
309 break;
310 case HandleType::UDP:
311 cb(*static_cast<UDPHandle *>(handle->data));
312 break;
313 default:
314 // returns the underlying handle, uvw doesn't manage it properly yet
315 cb(handle);
316 break;
317 }
318 }, &callback);
319 }
320
321 /**
322 * @brief Reinitialize any kernel state necessary in the child process after
323 * a fork(2) system call.
324 *
325 * Previously started watchers will continue to be started in the child
326 * process.
327 *
328 * It is necessary to explicitly call this function on every event loop
329 * created in the parent process that you plan to continue to use in the
330 * child, including the default loop (even if you don’t continue to use it
331 * in the parent). This function must be called before calling any API
332 * function using the loop in the child. Failure to do so will result in
333 * undefined behaviour, possibly including duplicate events delivered to
334 * both parent and child or aborting the child process.
335 *
336 * When possible, it is preferred to create a new loop in the child process
337 * instead of reusing a loop created in the parent. New loops created in the
338 * child process after the fork should not use this function.
339 *
340 * Note that this function is not implemented on Windows.<br/>
341 * Note also that this function is experimental in `libuv`. It may contain
342 * bugs, and is subject to change or removal. API and ABI stability is not
343 * guaranteed.
344 *
345 * An ErrorEvent will be emitted in case of errors.
346 *
347 * See the official
348 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/loop.html#c.uv_loop_fork)
349 * for further details.
350 */
351 void fork() noexcept;
352
353 /**
354 * @brief Gets user-defined data. `uvw` won't use this field in any case.
355 * @return User-defined data if any, an invalid pointer otherwise.
356 */
357 template<typename R = void>
358 std::shared_ptr<R> data() const {
359 return std::static_pointer_cast<R>(userData);
360 }
361
362 /**
363 * @brief Sets arbitrary data. `uvw` won't use this field in any case.
364 * @param uData User-defined arbitrary data.
365 */
366 void data(std::shared_ptr<void> uData);
367
368 /**
369 * @brief Gets the underlying raw data structure.
370 *
371 * This function should not be used, unless you know exactly what you are
372 * doing and what are the risks.<br/>
373 * Going raw is dangerous, mainly because the lifetime management of a loop,
374 * a handle or a request is in charge to the library itself and users should
375 * not work around it.
376 *
377 * @warning
378 * Use this function at your own risk, but do not expect any support in case
379 * of bugs.
380 *
381 * @return The underlying raw data structure.
382 */
383 const uv_loop_t * raw() const noexcept;
384
385 /**
386 * @brief Gets the underlying raw data structure.
387 *
388 * This function should not be used, unless you know exactly what you are
389 * doing and what are the risks.<br/>
390 * Going raw is dangerous, mainly because the lifetime management of a loop,
391 * a handle or a request is in charge to the library itself and users should
392 * not work around it.
393 *
394 * @warning
395 * Use this function at your own risk, but do not expect any support in case
396 * of bugs.
397 *
398 * @return The underlying raw data structure.
399 */
400 uv_loop_t * raw() noexcept;
401
402private:
403 std::unique_ptr<uv_loop_t, Deleter> loop;
404 std::shared_ptr<void> userData{nullptr};
405};
406
407
408// (extern) explicit instantiations
409
410extern template bool Loop::run<Loop::Mode::DEFAULT>() noexcept;
411extern template bool Loop::run<Loop::Mode::ONCE>() noexcept;
412extern template bool Loop::run<Loop::Mode::NOWAIT>() noexcept;
413
414
415}
416

419#include "loop.cpp"
420#endif

422#endif // UVW_LOOP_INCLUDE_H
